name: Public Panic
description: Your country is not prepared for the pandemic. The news of an unknown deadly virus being spread around the country has caused people to panic. People are asking the gvoernment to put a stop to the chaos.

choiceOne.description: Make public speechs and educate the public about the virus

log.content: The public calmed down after the government's education campaign, but many people has already potentially contacted the virus amid the chaos.

choiceTwo.description: Arrest people on the street and enforce curfew

log.content: People stopped panicking and started staying home after many has been arrested. Foreign governments condemn your country for your strict enforcement.

name: Educated Public
description: The public is more educated about the virus, making them less likely to panic, and take precaution against the virus.

name: Curfew
description: Rules are layed out requiring people to stay indoor at night. This reduction in human activity and interaction reduces the risk of virus spreading, but will cause many industries to take a hit financially.

name: Karen's Outrage
description: A group of Karens are claiming that quarantine rules are an infringement to their rights, and they are taking it on the streets to protest against the government.

log.content: The Karens are satisfied and stopped protesting. Business owners are happy that the rules are less strict, but it comes with the risk of spreading the virus with more human contact.
The Karens are cleaned off the street, foreign governments are denouncing your action as oppression.

name: Foreign Influence
description: Some foreign countires are using the situation as a way to attack your government's reputation.
